pull.title: Set minimum required Boost to 1.47.0
pull.body:
Boost is on the way out, but in the mean time, having the minimum set to 1.20.0 is misleading, and can lead to issues like #8868.

1.47.0 is the first version to include [Chrono](http://www.boost.org/users/history/version_1_47_0.html). See #8875 for some history.

events.body:
So you are updating the file to match _and_ at the same time upgrading the minimal requirement. Please always mention this in the PR text and not hide the first part.

Changes like this should be done in two commits, I think.
Concept ACK, but shouldn't some documentation need updating as well?

> Concept ACK, but shouldn't some documentation need updating as well?

If only we _had_ documentation for minimum version requirements, it should be updated. But doesn't look like we do, build-unix only lists the libraries necessary not their minimum supported versions. We've never really kept track of those.

Set minimum required Boost to 1.47.0

events.body:
This looks much better, thank you!

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8920/commits/6dd37237222f7102e223ece948150cb5c5087e3c

Build log diff:

```
-checking for boostlib >= 1.20.0... yes
+checking for boostlib >= 1.47.0... yes
```

Great!
An error when build with Boost 1.49: http://pastebin.com/b2JHAE01

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -96,7 +96,7 @@ if test "x$want_boost" = "xyes"; then
         libsubdirs="lib64 libx32 lib lib64"
         ;;
       ppc64|s390x|sparc64|aarch64|ppc64le)
-        libsubdirs="lib64 lib lib64 ppc64le"

@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@
 #   and this notice are preserved. This file is offered as-is, without any
 #   warranty.
 
-#serial 26
+#serial 27
comments.body: The serial should reflect the original version used as a base - coming from https://www.gnu.org/software/autoconf-archive/ax_boost_base.html

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -72,7 +72,7 @@ AC_ARG_WITH([boost-libdir],
 )
 
 if test "x$want_boost" = "xyes"; then
-    boost_lib_version_req=ifelse([$1], ,1.20.0,$1)
+    boost_lib_version_req=ifelse([$1], ,1.47.0,$1)
comments.body: concept ACK - though personally I'd prefer passing in this version as a parameter from our configure.ac, if possible, instead of changing this upstream file
